skill.name: datacommons-client
skill.description: Work with Data Commons, a platform providing programmatic access to public statistical data from global sources. Use this skill when working with demographic data, economic indicators, health statistics, environmental data, or any public datasets available through Data Commons. Applicable for querying population statistics, GDP figures, unemployment rates, disease prevalence, geographic entity resolution, and exploring relationships between statistical entities.
skill.summary: Work with Data Commons, a platform providing programmatic access to public statistical data from glo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No executable code is present, only documentation and usage examples. No sensitive file access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found.

content.value_statement: Public data is spread across many sources and formats. This skill gives a clear workflow to resolve places and query trusted statistics.
actual_capabilities: Resolve place names or coordinates to Data Commons DCIDs
Fetch latest or time series observations for statistical variables
Query hierarchies using relation expressions for places
List available statistical variables for an entity
Retrieve entity names and property labels from the graph
Convert responses to dicts or pandas-ready records
limitations: Requires an API key for datacommons.org access
Resolve endpoint supports place entities only
Data availability depends on Data Commons sources and facets

use_cases.title: Compare state metrics
use_cases.description: Compare population, income, and unemployment across states with a consistent data source.

use_cases.title: Build time series
use_cases.description: Retrieve historical series for a variable and prepare it for analysis.

use_cases.title: Validate regional coverage
use_cases.description: Check which statistical variables are available for target regions.

prompt_templates.title: Get latest population
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner query for a few places
prompt_templates.prompt: Resolve California, Texas, and New York to DCIDs and fetch the latest Count_Person values.

prompt_templates.title: Find available variables
prompt_templates.prompt: List available statistical variables for geoId/06 and highlight the top 10 by name.

prompt_templates.title: County hierarchy query
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch 2020 Median_Income_Household for all counties in California using a relation expression.

prompt_templates.title: Time series comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Get UnemploymentRate_Person time series for USA and Canada and describe key trend differences.

output_examples.input: Show the latest population for California and Texas.
output: Source: Data Commons facets from census.gov

best_practices: Resolve place names to DCIDs before querying observations
Use filter_facet_domains to keep data sources consistent
Check available variables before large queries
anti_patterns: Querying without resolving ambiguous place names
Requesting all dates when only the latest value is needed
Mixing facets from different sources without noting provenance

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, the prompts and workflows are compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What data limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Limits depend on the Data Commons API and available facets for each variable and entity.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with pandas workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, observation responses can be converted to pandas records for analysis.

faq.question: Does it access my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: No, the skill documentation does not access local files or credentials.

faq.question: What should I do if a query returns no data?
faq.answer: Check available variables for the entity and confirm the date or facet filters.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual API calls?
faq.answer: It provides clearer workflows and examples while still using the official Python client.
